sen.j: 紫微中台（しびちゅうだい）は藤原仲麻呂（恵美押勝）が749年に創設した、光明皇后（紫微中台創設当時、既に夫の聖武天皇は娘の孝謙天皇に譲位していたため、光明皇太后である）の家政機関。
sen.e: Shibichudai was the household agency of the Empress Komyo (at the time when Shibichudai was established, she was already Empress Dowager Komyo since her husband the Emperor Shomu had abdicated the throne to his daughter the Emperor Koken) which was established by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (EMI no Oshikatsu) in 749.

Shibichudai was a household agency of the Empress Komyo (at the time when Shibichudai was established, she was already Empress Dowager Komyo since her husband the Emperor Shomu had abdicated the throne to his daughter the Emperor Koken) which was established by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (EMI no Oshikatsu) in 749.

Shibichudai was a household agency of the Empress Komyo (at the time when Shibichudai was established, she was already Empress Dowager Komyo since her husband the Emperor Shomu had abdicated the throne to his daughter the Empress Koken) which was established by FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (also referred as EMI no Oshikatsu) in 749.

sen.j: 元来､皇后宮職・皇太后宮職と呼ばれていた組織が唐風に改称された。
sen.e: The agency originally called Kogogushiki (the empress household agency)/Kotaogogushiki (the empress dowager household agency) was renamed Tang-style name Shibichudai.
The agency originally called Kogogushiki (the empress household agency)/Kotaogogushiki (the empress dowager household agency) was renamed according to the Tang-style name of Shibichudai.
The agency originally called Kogogushiki (the empress household agency) or Kotaogogushiki (the empress dowager household agency) was renamed according to the Tang-style name of Shibichudai.

sen.j: 家政機関であったが光明皇太后の命令（令旨）を施行・兵権を発動する機能を持った。
sen.e: Though it was an household agency, it held the authority to implement the order (ryoji (orders issued by princes, empresses etc.)) of the Empress Dowager Komyo as well as to exercise military power.

sen.j: 仲麻呂の権力拡大とともに国家の実質的な最高権力機関・軍事機関へと変貌した。
sen.e: It became the de facto supreme authority/military arm of the nation according to the expansion of Nakamaro's power.

sen.j: 太政官に準じた位置にあり､長官の紫微令は準大納言待遇だった。
sen.e: Its status was equivalent to Daijokan (council of state) and its head Shibirei was treated equally with Dainagon (Councilor of State).

sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 天平勝宝9年5月20日（天平宝字元年・757年6月11日）紫微内相と改称されて準大臣待遇となるとともに、太政官の大臣が持つ内外諸兵事を管掌して、太政官・中務省を経ずして直接詔勅を実施する権限を得た。
sen.e: When Shibirei was renamed Shibinaisho and came to be treated equally with minister on June 11, 757, it seized the full power of Daijokan' ministers and obtained the authority to implement the Emperor's order without consulting Daijokan/Chumusho (Ministry of Central Affairs).

sen.j: 表面上は光明皇太后の家政機関の体裁を取っていたものの、実際には孝謙天皇－藤原仲麻呂に属する独自の軍事・行政機関として当時太政官を巻き込んで展開された反仲麻呂・反孝謙天皇の動き（2ヵ月後に橘奈良麻呂の乱が発生する）に備えたものとされている。
sen.e: Although it was the household agency of the Empress Dowager Komyo ostensibly, it was actually a military/administrative organization of the Emperor Koken/FUJIWARA no Nakamaro faction that was established in order to cope with the anti-Nakamaro/anti-Koken movement which was then active involving Daijokan (the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro occurred two months later).

sen.j: 758年に官職の唐風改称が行われると坤宮官と改称されて「居中奉勅、頒下諸司」を行う機関とされた。
sen.e: When Tang-style names were adopted for government organization in 758, it was renamed Kongukan and defined as the organization to "receive the Imperial orders and convey them to government officials".

sen.j: これにより、孝謙上皇・淳仁天皇の詔勅を紫微内相が奉じて太政官に代わって直接下達・実行させる機関と位置づけられたことで名実共に太政官と並ぶ機関となった。
sen.e: As a result, Shibinaisho was put into a position to convey/implement the order of the Retired Emperor Koken/the Emperor Junnin in place of Daijokan and Kongukan became the organization comparable to Daijokan both in name and reality.

sen.j: 長官職は創設以来仲麻呂が務めていたが､758年に仲麻呂が大保（右大臣）に転じて太政官の首班となり、紫微内相が空位になった。
sen.e: Nakamaro served as its head from the very beginning, but the post of Shibinaisho became vacant when Nakamaro was appointed to Oho (Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and became the top of Daijokan in 758.

sen.j: 重要性が低下していたとは言え、太政官から独立して独自の軍事力と詔勅下達権限を有した紫微中台の廃止は仲麻呂にとっては打撃が大きく、仲麻呂政権崩壊の遠因にもなった。
sen.e: Though its significance had already faded, the abolition of Shibichudai was not only a big blow to Nakamaro but also a remote cause of the collapse of Nakamaro administration since it was independent from Daijokan and held its own military power as well as the authority to convey Imperial orders.
